title: Lamar Odom’s family embraces Khloe Kardashian
text:
Jason LaVeris/FilmMagic Lamar Odom and Khloe Kardashian revoked their divorce filing on Wednesday. “We truly love and respect whomever he loves," his family said in a statement. Lamar Odom's family is throwing its support behind the former NBA star's rekindled relationship with Khloe Kardashian, a spokeswoman said Thursday.
The spokeswoman didn't explicitly name Kardashian but released a statement addressing Odom's personal life after he and his socialite spouse revoked their divorce filing Wednesday.
"In SINCERELY loving Lamar, we truly love and respect whomever he loves," said the statement from spokeswoman Alvina Alston, sent to the Daily News.
"We always have and will continue to do so. Together as a team, we will support and encourage him always," she said.
She gave another positive update on Odom's medical progress since he was found unresponsive in a Nevada brothel with blood and a white substance coming from his nose and mouth on Oct. 13.
"To our overwhelming delight, Lamar's courageous improvement continues on the incline in Los Angeles. He is beginning to gradually flourish both mentally and physically," she said.
View Gallery The relationship of Khloe and Lamar
"His use of speech has increased and he's more cognitively responsive," she said. "His medical team has executed an aggressive therapy regimen to aid in his progress."
Odom, 35, was transferred to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles on Monday after waking up from a coma Friday at Sunrise Hospital in Las Vegas.
Kardashian, 31, rushed to his side the same day he was admitted in extremely critical condition and has kept a constant vigil.
David Becker/Getty Images Lamar Odom's daughter Destiny Odom, left, son Lamar Odom Jr., second from right, and their Liza Morales exit through a back door after visiting Odom at Las Vegas' Sunrise Hospital.
She even missed her sister Kim Kardashian West's birthday celebration on Wednesday to stay with her hoopster hubby.
Unidentified sources told TMZ.com that Odom told Kardashian over the weekend he understood he almost died and had hit rock bottom.
"I am done with drugs," he reportedly told her, according to TMZ.
He also repeatedly told Kardashian he loved her, the celebrity website said.
FREDERIC J. BROWN/AFP/Getty Images Odom, 35, was transferred to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles on Monday after waking up from a coma Friday at Sunrise Hospital in Las Vegas. Splash News/Splash News The Spearmint Rhino club in Las Vegas, Nev., where Odom allegedly spent several nights in the week leading up to his time at the Love Ranch South brothel. After finding Odom unconscious and calling for help, brothel staffers told authorities the former Laker used cocaine on the Saturday before his collapse and later combined alcohol and herbal Viagra, the Nye County Sheriff said.
He'd been staying at the Love Ranch South about 80 miles northwest of Sin City for a four-day party bender involving two hand-picked hookers and a bill hitting $75,000.
It was back in 2009 that he and Kardashian tied the knot afer a one-month whirlwind romance. She filed for divorce in December 2013 amid rumors of cheating and drug abuse.
After the breakup, the "Keeping Up With The Kardashians" star confessed on camera she wished they still were living as man and wife.
